commenter_a: @webpagelink David W. Blight described the day: This was the first Memorial Day. African Americans invented Memorial Day in Charleston, South Carolina. What you have there is black Americans recently freed from slavery announcing to the world with their flowers, their feet, and their songs what the war had been about. What they basically were creating was the Independence Day of a Second American Revolution.
post_message: As part of our Memorial Day special, watch this speech by former Rep. Pat Schroeder recorded at the conference, "Vietnam: The Power of Protest."
